contents.literal:
I want to go to the market to sell my fruits.  I have several bags of fruit, each with their own weight in kg.  In addition, I have a 20 kg provisional booth I will carry myself.

The scout group Js want to help me out for a Bob for Job. Each of the five youngsters in that group has its own limit in what he or she can carry.

As it so happens, the total weight of bags of fruit is exactly what the group can carry.  So the bags needs to be divided carefully between the youngsters. You can advise me by by left - right clicking on one of the bags in the combination chart, and selecting to which person the bag should be re-assigned.

By invoking the action "Optimize" in the lower right, the application will assign the remaining bags of fruit if that is possible.  The other bags, and the booth, I need to carry myself.

When you don't assign bags yourself, but let the optimizer assign all bags, you will note that all bags will be assigned to youngsters and I only have to carry the booth.

Question:

Joey likes Kiwis very much, so he grabs the bag with Kiwis and offers to carry that bag to the market.  Using the optimizer in the application, you quickly notice that the remaining bags cannot be divided among the youngsters and a bag of 2 kg is still assigned to me.

Why cannot you assign the remaining bags among the youngsters?

If you do not have an answer to this question, you may want to check out the hint first, and if that does not help the spoiler.

Spoiler / Answer.

As you know, adding two even numbers together will result in an even number.

Thus, to reach a weight with an odd number of kilos, there must be at least one bag weighing an odd number of kilos.

There are two people, the ladies actually, that can carry an odd number of kilos. 

There are also just two bags weighing an odd number of kilos.

In addition, the total weight of fruit to be carried, 30 kg, exactly matches what the youngster can carry.

Combining this, the bags of fruit with an odd weight, Kiwi and Cherry, need to be assigned to the ladies if all bags are to be carried by the youngsters.

title.literal: This widget is used to add / suppress tdevelopment support
The weight of each bag of fruit

contents.literal:
The German company OxyGem fills oxygen tanks. It has separate locations to

*  Distillate oxygen
*  Pump oxygen
*  Bottle oxygen

Lately, due to the corona crisis, there is significantly more demand. However, the demand cannot be met. To the management of Oxygem, this is a very unpleasant surprise; the distillation factories are  quite capable, and can handle together far greater demands.

Your task is to determine the cause of the unmet demand and advise on a remedy.

Hopefully, this map widget will help you in your analysis. It features:

* Item menu, left click - right click on one of the  icons, and you will get a menu of the actions you can do on a location.
* widget menu, identified by the hamburger menu in the right upper of the map widget. Here you can solve the underlying optimization problem.
* in the control side panel, various settings can be adapted.

More information on the actions available in the How-To article associated with this example.

One tip: start with solving the optimization problem.

The Levram company operates three production lines, nick named King Kong, Hercules, and Antman.  Each production line handles an order as a single task: stopping a task halfway leads to clogging and other problems. Even though all three lines can handle all types of orders, King Kong is more suited to handling orders with large items, Antman is more suited to handling orders with small items, and Hercules is somewhat in between.

As a production planner, you were notified yesterday by Quality Control that there will be a surprise inspection on 2016-05-10 between 08:00 and 14:00 on all three production lines. They expect each production line to be halted for at least two hours to do the inspection. Of course, Business Development wants the production to be interrupted minimally.

Hopefully, the Gantt Chart widget will help you in replanning existing orders.

This widget distinguishes between two types of tasks:

* Production tasks, where a product type, amount, and Due date are specified.
* Maintenance tasks (product type none), where a start time, duration, and production line are specified.

In addition, tasks can be scheduled in two ways:
* Manually, these tasks have a blue border and can be dragged across the Gantt Chart. In addition, there are more Right Mouse menu actions available for these tasks.
* By the internal scheduler of the application, which minimizes the makespan of all tasks. This internal schedular is invoked by clicking Optimize in the lower right menu.

Upon opening the Gantt Chart page, the existing workload is read in.  In addition, you can create new tasks, by selecting the "new job" action in the lower right menu.

Welcome to Wonderful WebUI Widgets.

AIMMS is designed for interactive optimization applications.
To let you experience these applications, this application provides some one-page examples.
Each page has a short story with a question and it is designed to help you answer this question within a few minutes.
The story can be found in the side panel of that page.

The first page illustrates the map widget by letting you analyze the supply chain within an organization.

The second page illustrates the Gantt Chart by letting you plan maintenance tasks on production lines.

The third page illustrates the combination chart by letting you lead scouts in a Bob for a Job project.
